column4: I know there's a better way to find out what driver you're using, but I usually just use compiz-check
Saw a forum mod post a link to it once and I've used it since ;)
what is that file for and what does it do?
That tells you what driver you're using, whether it's fglrx or vesa
So you're using the open source radeon driver, not ati's proprietary fglrx driver
So if you thought you were using fglrx, you're doing it wrong ;)
Right and that means squat because?
I've been using a bit of everything been as though I don't know wtf to do to fix this
So you're not in low graphics mode then, that's a plus
alraune didn't do anything to your xorg.conf, you did?
Right, but you were still the one who made the changes, don't blame others :) If you're having this much trouble with the radeon driver, I'd consider just using vesa and be done with it
err that person pastebinned the file and I just copied it
Sure you did, you copied them in
Just change the line driver    "radeon" to driver    "vesa" and call it a day. Hard is relative ;)
alraune says he's got the original xorg.conf saved... Have you tried just using that?
You could just use the one alraune posted and add Driver    "vesa" in the screen section...

It's really not that complicated. I would first try using alraune's saved xorg.conf (that he was nice enough to save for you since you didn't make a backup.) and if that doesn't work just add the line Driver    "vesa" in the screen section of xorg.conf and reset X
